    • Method Detail

      • getTimeout

        public Long getTimeout()
        Gets the maximum amount of time that synchronous method calls will block and wait.

        If this property is null, the value is from configuration property NetworkConfig.Keys.EXCHANGE_LIFETIME of the effective endpoint.

        Returns:
        The timeout in milliseconds, or null.

      • setTimeout

        public CoapClient setTimeout(Long timeout)
        Sets the maximum amount of time that synchronous method calls will block and wait. Setting this property to 0 will result in methods waiting infinitely.

        If this property is null, the value is from configuration property NetworkConfig.Keys.EXCHANGE_LIFETIME of the effective endpoint.

        Under normal circumstances this property should be set to at least the EXCHANGE_LIFETIME (the default) in order to account for potential retransmissions of request and response messages.

        When running over DTLS and the client is behind a NAT firewall, requests may frequently fail (run into timeout) due to the fact that the client has been assigned a new IP address or port by the firewall and the peer can no longer associate this client's address with the original DTLS session. In such cases it might be worthwhile to set the value of this property to a smaller number so that the timeout is detected sooner and a new session can be negotiated. You may also consider to use the automatic session resumption to pass such a NAT firewall, see DtlsConnectorConfig.autoResumptionTimeoutMillis.

        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout in milliseconds. null, if EXCHANGE_LIFETIME of effective endpoint should be used.
        Returns:
        This CoAP client for command chaining.

        Returns:
        this CoapClient

      • useExecutor

        public CoapClient useExecutor()
        Sets a single-threaded executor to this client. All handlers will be invoked by this executor. Note that the client executor uses a user thread (not a daemon thread) that needs to be stopped to exit the program by calling shutdown().
        Returns:
        the CoAP client
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if executor is already set or used.

      • setExecutor

        public CoapClient setExecutor(ExecutorService executor)
        Sets the executor service for this client. All handlers will be invoked by this executor. The executor will shutdown on shutdown().
        Parameters:
        executor - the executor service
        Returns:
        the CoAP client
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if executor is already set or used.
        NullPointerException - if provided executor is null

      • setExecutor

        public CoapClient setExecutor(ExecutorService executor,
                     boolean detach)
        Sets the executor service for this client. All handlers will be invoked by this executor. The executor will shutdown on shutdown(), if not detached.
        Parameters:
        executor - the executor service
        detach - true, if the executor is not shutdown on shutdown(), false, otherwise.
        Returns:
        the CoAP client
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if executor is already set or used.
        NullPointerException - if provided executor is null

        Returns:

      • setEndpoint

        public CoapClient setEndpoint(Endpoint endpoint)
        Sets the endpoint this client is supposed to use. The endpoint maybe shared among clients. Therefore shutdown() doesn't close nor destroy it.
        Parameters:
        endpoint - the endpoint
        Returns:
        the CoAP client

      • useEarlyNegotiation

        public CoapClient useEarlyNegotiation(int size)
        Let the client use early negotiation for the blocksize (16, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512, or 1024). Other values will be matched to the closest logarithm dualis.
        Parameters:
        size - the preferred block size
        Returns:
        the CoAP client

      • useLateNegotiation

        public CoapClient useLateNegotiation()
        Let the client use late negotiation for the block size (default).
        Returns:
        the CoAP client

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shutdown the client-specific executor service, when not detached. Only needed if useExecutor() or setExecutor(ExecutorService) are used (i.e., a client-specific executor service was set).

      • getEffectiveEndpoint

        protected Endpoint getEffectiveEndpoint(Request request)
        Returns the effective endpoint that the specified request is supposed to be sent over. If an endpoint has explicitly been set to this CoapClient, this endpoint will be used. If no endpoint has been set, the client will effectively use a default endpoint of the EndpointManager.
        Parameters:
        request - the request to be sent
        Returns:
        the effective endpoint that the request is going o be sent over.

        protected void execute(Runnable job)
